solution.text:
In the given figure we have to find out new height which is equal to H2.
Given that :
Initial height of the building H1 = _{i}_
Angle A = _{k}_\(^\circ\).
Since, building tilted only no damage occur
hence,
H1 = L.
Also, from similarity
angle A = angle B
Now, using trigonometry ratio
cos(B) = \(H2\over L\)
cos(_{k}_) = \(H2\over _{i}_\)
i.e., H2 = cos(_{k}_)*_{i}_
i.e., H2 = _{{m*i}}_
So, the net height of the building is _{{m*i}}_

content.text: There was a _{i}_ m high building in Pune. In an earthquake the building got tilted by an angle of _{k}_\(^\circ\).find out the new height of the building.
